title: Check Even or Odd
segments:
Problem:
Write a function that takes an integer as input and returns 'Even' if the number is even, and 'Odd' if the number is odd.

Constraint:
The input will be a valid integer.

Example 1:
Input: 4 
Output: Even

Example 2: 
Input: 7
Output: Odd
hints: Use the modulus operator (%) to determine if the number is even or odd.
If the number % 2 equals 0, it is even; otherwise, it is odd.

solutions.title: Java Even or Odd Solution
segments:
Intuition: 
First I remebered that any even integer is divisible by two, but odd integers are one greater than an even integer.

Implementation: 
For this problem I used the modulos operator, Math.abs, and an if statement.

Analysis: 
If the integer 10 is inputted, 10 modulos 2 will return 0, the Math.abs does nothing, but 0 is equal to 0 so the method will return even. If the integer is -9, -9 modulos 2 will return -1, the Math.abs makes this integer a positive 1, since 1 is not equal to 0, the if statement is ignored and the method returns Odd.

Complexity: 
This approach has a time complexity of O(1) since the method takes the same amount of operations for any integer.
